title: Biotech IPOs Are Risky Business. Here’s How To Do a Deal Right
text:
David Schenkein, a general partner at GV, the venture-capital arm of Google parent Alphabet (ticker: GOOGL) and co-head of GV’s life science team, has been on both sides of the board room. In 2013, Schenkein, a medical oncologist, took Agios Pharmaceuticals (AGIO) public as its CEO. In a recent interview with Barron’s, Schenkein, a panelist on Barron’s biotech roundtable, discussed what he learned from his experience at Agios, where he remains executive chairman. Agios shares have returned more than 90% since their IPO.

...
description: GV partner David Schenkein took Agios Pharmaceuticals public in 2013. Here’s how the experience informs his work as a venture capitalist.
